title: Criminal Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020 (No. 13 of 2020), hereby
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Civil Law and Criminal Law (Designated
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Civil Law and Criminal Law (Designated 

Body - Agriculture) Order 2020. 

Designated bodies
text_norm: 1 order may cited civil law criminal law (designated body - agriculture) order 2020 designated body

title: Criminal Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020 (No. 13 of 2020), hereby
heading: 2. The following bodies or persons are designated as a designated body in
text_raw:
2. The following bodies or persons are designated as a designated body in 
accordance with section 31(3) of the Civil Law and Criminal Law 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020 (No. 13 of 2020) for the purposes of 
holding hearings by remote means: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

the Aquaculture Licences Appeals Board, established under 
section 22 of the Fisheries (Amendment) Act 1997 (No. 23 of 
1997) and empowered to hear and determine appeals against a 
decision of the Minister in respect of an aquaculture licence; 

an Appeals Officer, appointed under section 6 of the Fisheries 
(Amendment) Act 2003 (No. 21 of 2003) and empowered to hear 
and determine appeals against a decision of a licencing authority 
in respect of a sea-fishing boat licence; 

an Appeals Officer, appointed under section 2 of the Agriculture 
Appeals Act 2001 (No. 29 of 2001) and empowered to hear and 
determine appeals against decisions in respect of applications for 
entitlement under the schemes set out in Schedule 1 to the Act; 

the Forestry Appeals Committee, established under section 14A 
of the Agriculture Appeals Act 2001 (No. 29 of 2001) and 
empowered to hear and determine appeals against decisions under 
an enactment or statutory instrument set out in Schedule 2 to the 
Act; 

the Fitness to Practise Committee, established under section 71 of 
the Veterinary Practice Act 2005 (No. 22 of 2005) and 
empowered to hold inquiries, hear evidence and prepare a report 
on the fitness to practice of a registered person under the Act; 

the Determination Panel, established under and in accordance 
with Regulation 5 of the European Union (Common Fisheries 
Policy) (Point System) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 318 of 2020) 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 9th October, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [411] 3 

and empowered to hear and determine whether a serious 
infringement has occurred for the purposes of those Regulations; 

(g) 

an Appeals Officer, appointed under Regulation 11 of the 
European Union (Common Fisheries Policy) (Point System) 
Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 318 of 2020) and empowered to hear 
and determine an appeal under Regulation 12 of those 
Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

1 October, 2020. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [411]

title: Criminal Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020 (No. 13 of 2020), hereby
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order designates a number of bodies or persons under the remit of the 
Minister of Agriculture, Food and the Marine for the purposes of section 31 of 
the Civil Law and Criminal Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020. The 
bodies and persons designated under that section may carry out their statutory 
function to hold hearings by holding such hearings remotely using electronic 
means. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [411] 5
